intro: Spergularia coquimbensis, commonly known as the Coquimbo sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Chile. It is a small, annual herb that thrives in sandy and saline soils, often found in coastal and desert environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, followed by capsules containing minute seeds. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh conditions. Spergularia coquimbensis plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and is part of the Caryophyllaceae family.
